body.name: Ambush in the Dusty Mines: A Historical Western Adventure Novel

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Charlton amidst the innocents of Dixie Valley.
reviews.reviewText: A novel written this author is of the finest quality. Dixie Valley, a small town yearns to have a railroad link to connect it to Virginia City and beyond. It would allow them to have access to mail and to transport their products. A charlton by the name of Clyde comes to the town proposing he will bring the link to their town. Only Carson, A Rebel soldier, hiding out after the war at a silver mine inherited from Major Grant was the only one who's saw Clyde for the crook he was. Betsy, a scorned woman, acted as a spy for him to find out the weaknesses of many of the members of the town. His promises in the form of fulfilling those wants and desires caused many town members to join into the railroad movement. Jolene,the Dixie Valley teacher, felt the railroad would get her a real school to teach her students. She met and felt tender toward Carson. The plan to take the railroad right through the center of town was never disclosed to the people. No-one would believe Carson who attempted to warn them because Clyde let them know he was an ex rebel soldier. Much action occurs throughout this novel to determine the fates of Dixie Valley and its people. I read as an ARC and highly recommend to others to read. As always this puts forth an excellent novel about the West.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This book contains lots of intriguing occurrences to hold a reader’s interest. The reader is introduced to Carson in 1865 in Virginia during a battle with Union forces. He is traumatized by wrongs done by both sides. His company commander gave him the rights to a silver mine in Nevada upon his death. Carson went to that mine, but in his desolation only secluded himself there. Jolene and Dixie Valley are introduced during 1867. This town is Jolene’s hometown, as schoolteacher she is watching its decline and in her naivety thinks a railroad will revive it. Unfortunately, a rapacious covert villain, Clyde came to take over the town. Carson could see through the ruse, Jolene could not. Childhood friend of Jolene, Betsy statement to Clyde “You’re going to demolish the entire town to build a railroad…for the town?” Clyde’s response “This is for the entire country, and more importantly, my legacy.” Why didn’t Betsy call him out about this dangerously insane proposition? Betsy is one that wants town to be destroyed her statement “I don’t know about you, but I have so much energy right now, I could explode”. Need to read this story to know what went boom. Moral of story don’t mess with country folks. Unable to access extended epilogue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great western romance
reviews.reviewText: This is the story of two young people that have different outlooks on their future. Jolene is a young unmarried school teacher with high dreams for her towns future. Carson is a former soldier that in the end believes he fought for the wrong side of the civil war once it was over. He moves to where his former commander that served as a father figure gave him the deed to his silver mine upon his death. Carson stayed mostly to himself not wanting anyone to know he was a former soldier. When the town is nearly destroyed they team up to rid themselves of the man with money wanting to destroy their town and put a railroad in to line his own pockets.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Carson, Jolene, and Wilder, will definitely keep you turning pages throughout this amazing story!
reviews.reviewText: Another five star sensation that has no slowdowns from cover to cover! The Author's uncanny ability to cover everything exciting is so enjoyable that you will definitely keep turning pages to see what happens next!Some of the most endearing, and definitely entertaining, storylines I have ever followed! I assure you will find yourself riding along with these outstanding characters from beginning to end! Just one exciting episode after the other that will pacify your innermost desires!Most definitely recommend these outstanding characters to all readers,as they will pacify anyone's desired expectations, cover to cover! Try it! You'll love it!!!😃

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Mixed feelings about Book.
reviews.reviewText: This book left me with mixed feelings for several different reasons. Some of the book seemed unreal or didn’t seem like it would happen in that time period. The author put a lot of his feelings in the book that seemed like he was trying to sell his point of view about the South during the War Between the States. The Carson character was fair but could have been stronger. Jolene’s was a total weak character. Besty went in and out of character. Clyde’s was a total nut job as a character, going in and out of character, couldn’t make up his mind to be totally bad or just small bad. For Old West characters everybody in the town didn’t have a positive point going for them. There should have been some Old Timers that stood up to Clyde from the start. The author has several books on the past that are better than this one. I guess that is what surprised me so much, is this book doesn’t seem like his type of book.The author needs to put his picture and bio with the books he writes so you can get a feel of the author in the books.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed reading this novel very good storyline

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An enjoyable story!
reviews.reviewText: This was a great story that has an amazing storyline and characters! I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a story about a former Confederate soldier that has come to a small town in Nevada to live and work a silver mine that was bequeathed to him as his commander and friend died on the battlefield.Carson McCoy doesn't want much from life but just enough to get by. Jolene Fleming in the girl in town that everyone loves, she the schoolteacher, baker, and all around nice person but just not sure what her life will bring. Small dying town and a robber baron railroad man arrives to mess with everyone. Good prevails but takes a while to get there.

The plot makes no sense but that's ok. What's not Ok is that the writer forgets a character is female, forgets another one is not an oil tycoon and when people go to the mine they are not in the saloon.I don't know how some authors can claim to be Amazon best sellers

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 7, 2024
